_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Name: Washington Beef, LLC  Toppenish, Washington Plant

Toppenish, WA  98948

Parent Company: AB Foods, Inc.

RMP Facility ID: 100000107804

Submission Receipt Date: 6/17/2015

 

This RMP was last updated on 6/17/2015).

 

RMP Executive Summary below:

 

CORPORATE SAFETY COMMITMENTS



Washington Beef, LLC has a beef processing plant located in Toppenish, Washington. Washington Beef is committed to providing its employees and the surrounding community with a safe and healthy environment.  The Risk Management Program is fundamental to meeting that commitment. Participants in an industry that both contributes to, and is dependant on a healthy environment, Washington Beef is continually at the forefront of innovation and implementation of new technologies and safety features into its processes.





DESCRIPTION OF FACILITY AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES



The Washington Beef Toppenish processing facility produces beef and beef by-products.  The process includes Processing, Fabrication, and Cold Storage rooms as well as office and maintenance areas. The cold storage rooms use ammonia as a refrigerant. 







ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM



Washington Beef's accident prevention/loss control systems and policies involve an approach that uses planning, procedures, technologies, and best-management practices.  The OSHA-PSM and the EPA-RMP plans work together to identify potential on-site hazards and off-site consequences and mitigate and control them to the best of our ability.





The RMP Prevention Program is comprised of the 14 elements of OSHAs PSM program, namely: 

1.    Employee Participation

2.    Process Safety Information

3.    Process Hazard Analysis

4.    Management of Change

5.    Pre-Startup Safety Review

6.    Operating Procedures

7.    Hot Work Permits

8.    Employee Training

9.    Incident Investigation

10.    Mechanical Integrity

11.    Emergency Planning & Response

12.    Contractor Safety, and 

13.    Compliance Audits

14.     Trade Secrets

Washington Beef is com

mitted to the active and continued use each of these elements and views them as key to providing a safe workplace and community.







FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There have been no accidental releases at its Toppenish, Washington Facility in the last five years from covered processes that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM  



The Washington Beef facility has an Emergency Action Plan which has been coordinated (reviewed) with the Yakima County LEPC.



The purpose of the Emergency Action Plan is to protect the lives and health of our employees, visitors, contractors and those in the community by establishing policies and procedures, then training all employees to respond to any incidents in a safe and timely manner.



The plan provides specific procedures for:



1. Alerting and evacuating employees, visitors, and contractors safely and efficiently.



2. Conducting activities in a manner that protects the safety of employees, the public, and the environment

    

2. The preferred means for reporting fires, hazardous materials incidents, medical, and any other emergencies

    

3. Emergency escape procedures and emergency escape route assignments

    

4. Procedures to account for all employees including contractors and visitors

    

5. Names of agencies and persons to contact for further assistance, information, or explanation of the plan.

    

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



Washington Beef is serious about its responsibility for the safety of its employees, neighbors, and the community. Improvements to safety are regularly being reviewed by receiving input from employee participation groups such as the Safety committees as well as learning from practice drills and modifying the programs accordingly.
